medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in usual state of health until one day prior to presentation when she developed epigastric abdominal discomfort. Over the next two days, pain migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), described as constant and non-radiating with severity that worsened with movement and no alleviating factors. Associated symptoms included chills, anorexia, nausea, and non-bloody emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, anxiety/depression, insomnia; past surgical history includes inguinal hernia repair and exploratory laparoscopy for fertility workup.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gastrointestinal malignancy or inflammatory bowel disease.
